intro: Liparia opposita, commonly known as the oppositeleaf lipara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in early spring. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is often found in woodland edges and rocky slopes, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
